articles.description: LATAM Airlines <LTM.SN>, the continent's largest carrier, said on Friday it lost $573 million in the third quarter, as the company continues a bankruptcy restructuring process that started in May because of the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: Airbus monthly jet deliveries surge in October to near 2019 level
articles.description: Airbus delivered 72 aircraft in October, nearly matching its tally in the same month last year, as it focuses on stabilising cash generation to weather the coronavirus crisis.
articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.title: EU set to impose tariffs on $4 billion U.S. goods next week
articles.description: The European Union is likely to impose tariffs on $4 billion of U.S. imports including planes and plane parts next week in retaliation over U.S. subsidies for aircraft maker Boeing <BA.N>, EU diplomats said on Friday.
articles.content:
By Philip Blenkinsop

articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: France sees smoother trade ties with U.S. if Biden triumphs, says minister
articles.description: France expects smoother trade relations with the United States should Democratic contender Joe Biden win the presidential vote, with greater alignment on sustainable development and more multilateral cooperation, trade minister Franck Riester said.

articles.author: Giulia Paravicini, Dawit Endeshaw
articles.title: U.N. chief 'deeply alarmed' by armed clashes in Ethiopia's Tigray
articles.description: The head of the United Nations said he was deeply alarmed by fighting in Ethiopia's northern Tigray region, where federal troops have been exchanging fire with the powerful ethnic faction that led the ruling coalition for decades.

By Giulia Paravicini, Dawit Endeshaw

articles.title: Ethiopia says military push has limited aims, as U.N. sounds alarm
articles.description: Ethiopia's federal military operations in the north have "clear, limited and achievable objectives", Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said on Friday, after the head of the United Nations said he was deeply alarmed by fighting in the country's Tigray region.

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.title: U.S. job growth slows in October; part-time workers increase
articles.description: The U.S. economy created the fewest jobs in five months in October and more Americans are working part time, the clearest evidence yet that the recovery from the pandemic recession was slowing as fiscal stimulus ends and new COVID-19 cases explode.

articles.title: Smallest job gains in five months expected as U.S. labor market momentum wanes
articles.description: U.S. employers likely hired the fewest workers in five months in October, in what would be clearest indication yet that the end of fiscal stimulus and exploding new COVID-19 infections were sapping momentum from the economic recovery.
